info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 12:14AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following creek in Indiana...
Wildcat Creek near Lafayette.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following waterways in Indiana...
Sugar Creek at New Palestine and Edinburgh.
Mill Creek near Cataract.
Big Blue River at Shelbyville and Carthage.
Driftwood River near Edinburgh.
Youngs Creek at Amity.
Buck Creek at Acton.
Muscatatuck River at Vernon.
Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
.Significant and some major flooding is expected to develop in central and southern Indiana due to prior rains and additional rounds of heavy rainfall through Sunday.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Youngs Creek at Amity.
* WHEN...From early this morning until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Significant flooding in progress. Parks and some local roads are flooded by a foot or more of water. Agricultural flooding is noticeable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM EDT Friday the stage was 5.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning and continue rising to a crest of 10.1 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this afternoon by around 315 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
